content.question: A store is having a 12-hour sale. The total number of shoppers who have entered the store t hours after the sale begins is modeled by the function S defined by S(t) = 0.5t4−16t3 + 144t2 for 0 ≤ t ≤ 12. At time t = 0, when the sale begins, there are no shoppers in the store. (a) At what rate are shoppers entering the store 3 hours after the start of the sale?

frqParts.text: A store is having a 12-hour sale. The total number of shoppers who have entered the store t hours after the sale begins is modeled by the function S defined by S(t) = 0.5t4−16t3 + 144t2 for 0 ≤ t ≤ 12. At time t = 0, when the sale begins, there are no shoppers in the store. (a) At what rate are shoppers entering the store 3 hours after the start of the sale?

(b) Find the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mn>9</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>S</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43F5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mn>9</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>S</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43F5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of this problem.

(c) The rate at which shoppers leave the store, measured in shoppers per hour, is modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi> L </mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGmbaaaa@39CD@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi> L </mi> <mo stretchy="false"> ( </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo stretchy="false"> ) </mo> <mo> = </mo> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 80 </mn> <mo> + </mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn> 4400 </mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi> t </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 14 </mn> <mi> t </mi> <mo> + </mo> <mn> 55 </mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B1B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 12 </mn> </mrow> </math> . According to the model, how many shoppers are in the store at the end of the sale (time <math> </math> t = 12 )? Give your answer to the nearest whole number.

(d) Using the given models, find the time t , <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 12 </mn> </mrow> </math> , at which the number of shoppers in the store is the greatest. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify common underlying structures in problems involving different contextual situations.
